Description: Schist bowl with an incised inscription: open bowl of grey schist with a flat base and incurving rim. The base is countersunk on the interior. On the side of the bowl there is an incised inscription. Restored from fragments.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' III (London, 1958), 61 and pl. 83, no. 10; G. T. Martin, 'Hetepka', 17 and pl. 19, no. 2; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 438; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit, supplement (Wiesbaden, 1964), 33, 76, abb. 1069; B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III, pt. 2 (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 446.
